蔡倫.definition: Cai Lun (-121), the inventor of the papermaking process

蔡元培.definition: Cai Yuanpei (1868-1940), educationist and politician, president of Peking University 1917-27

蔡司公司.definition: Zeiss Company (Carl Zeiss AG, optical and opto-electronic industries. hq in Oberkochen, Germany)

蔡國強.definition: Cai Guoqiang (1957-), contemporary Chinese artist working with firework displays and light shows

蔡志忠.definition: Tsai Chih Chung (1948-), famous Taiwanese cartoonist specializing in retelling the Chinese classics

蔡東藩.definition: Cai Dongfan (1877-1945), historian and historical novelist

蔡甸.definition: Caidian district of Wuhan city 武漢市|武汉市[Wu3 han4 shi4], Hubei

蔡甸區.definition: Caidian district of Wuhan city 武漢市|武汉市[Wu3 han4 shi4], Hubei

蔡英文.definition: Tsai Ing-wen (1956-), Taiwanese DPP politician, president of the Republic of China 2016-2024

蔡鍔.definition: Cai E (1882-1916), military leader who was a key figure in the establishment the National Protection Army 護國軍|护国军[Hu4guo2jun1], which in 1916 fought the forces of Yuan Shikai 袁世凱|袁世凯[Yuan2 Shi4kai3], who had tried to reestablish the monarchy with himself as emperor
